creator: mayankleoboy1@gmail.com

comments.text:
Created attachment 8981140
Non-WR.mp4

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:62.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/62.0
Build ID: 20180527220122

Steps to reproduce:

1. Enable WR.
2. Go to https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1434130#c13
3. Select the middle paragraph.
4. SCroll with touchpad slowly


Actual results:

If you observe carefully, the white space between the lines (white space between the selected blue text) fills and then whites out.
This creates a blinking/shimmer effect when selected paragraph of text is scrolled


Expected results:

less so.
comments.author: mayankleoboy1@gmail.com

comments.text: I can repro this on Windows (but not on macOS).
comments.author: bugmail@mozilla.staktrace.com

comments.text: Presumably this is a jibble-jabble issue inside WR since it happens during async scrolling when we're not sending new display lists. /cc nical
comments.author: bugmail@mozilla.staktrace.com

comments.text: I could confirm the first range on Windows. The other range had GPU process crashs/fallbacks.

summary: in selected text,  of a paragraph with multiple lines, white space between lines blink when scrolled
